session.stop_reason: well past soft limit (8 issues vs 3-4 recommended)

issues_completed.title: Add circuit statistics and summary panel
issues_completed.notes: New widget with live-updating stats via observer pattern. Smooth implementation.

issues_completed.title: Add simulation presets
issues_completed.notes: PresetManager with JSON persistence, 5 built-in presets, CRUD for user presets.

issues_completed.title: Validate cross-platform compatibility
issues_completed.notes: Fixed wrdata path backslash issue for Windows. Mostly testing/audit.

issues_completed.title: Add keyboard/tab navigation
issues_completed.notes: Escape key handling for wire cancel + deselect, focus policies.

issues_completed.title: Production-harden existing prototype features
issues_completed.notes: Palette search refactor + dirty flag. Required rebase conflict resolution.

issues_completed.title: Annotate schematic with DC operating point results
issues_completed.notes: SI formatter, branch current parsing, canvas overlay, distinct styling, View toggle.

issues_completed.title: Display power dissipation per component
issues_completed.notes: Power calc from V^2/R + VI, Properties Panel integration, SI-prefixed output.

critical.issue: black version mismatch between pre-commit hook (25.1.0) and pip install (26.1.0)
critical.impact: Every commit fails on first attempt. Must re-stage and retry after black hook reformats.
critical.fix: Pin black version in requirements-dev.txt to match .pre-commit-config.yaml rev (25.1.0), OR update pre-commit config to use same version as pip. Run: `pip install 'black==25.1.0'` or update `.pre-commit-config.yaml` rev to match installed version.

critical.issue: Context window exhaustion during long sessions
critical.impact: Session was interrupted mid-issue #56 (commit pending) requiring context restore. Conversation summary lost implementation details.
critical.time_wasted_per_occurrence: 2-3 minutes re-orienting, risk of lost context
critical.fix: CLAUDE.md soft limit of 3-4 issues is good. Consider adding a hard stop at 5 issues, or use checkpointing more aggressively.

moderate.issue: replace_all with indentation breaks multi-level nesting
moderate.impact: Using Edit tool's replace_all to add `self.properties_panel.clear_simulation_results()` after every `canvas.clear_node_voltages()` produced wrong indentation because the replacement string had fixed indentation but the original occurrences were at different indent levels.
moderate.frequency: When bulk-replacing across different indent levels
moderate.fix: Avoid replace_all for statements that appear at different indentation levels. Instead, edit each occurrence individually.

moderate.issue: Rebase conflicts from PRs merged mid-session
moderate.impact: Issue #56 had a merge conflict after rebase because #148 PR was merged to main while working. Required manual conflict resolution.
moderate.frequency: When multiple PRs are created in quick succession and some get auto-merged
moderate.fix: This is expected and handled correctly. The workflow step 'rebase on origin/main' catches this. No change needed.

minor.issue: Board item ID lookup requires JSON parsing
minor.impact: gh project item-list piped to python sometimes fails. Must write to temp file first.
minor.fix: Already documented in CLAUDE.md. Works fine with temp file approach.

minor.issue: main_window.py is a God Object (~1500 lines)
minor.impact: Almost every feature touches this file, creating merge conflicts and making it hard to reason about changes.
minor.fix: Future refactoring: extract simulation display, menu setup, and property handling into separate mixins or modules.

high_priority.impact: Eliminates the #1 friction point (failed commits on every single commit)
high_priority.how: Add to Makefile: `sync-hooks: pip install black==$(grep 'rev:' .pre-commit-config.yaml | grep psf | ... )` or simply pin `black==25.1.0` in requirements-dev.txt

high_priority.recommendation: Add auto-merge for agent PRs with passing CI
high_priority.impact: Eliminates rebase conflicts between consecutive agent PRs. Agent PRs that pass CI would auto-merge, so the next branch starts from an up-to-date main.
high_priority.how: Enable GitHub auto-merge feature + require CI checks. Agent sets `gh pr merge --auto --squash` after creating PR.

high_priority.impact: Eliminates the 5-step preflight checklist from CLAUDE.md. One command verifies venv, deps, hooks, clean tree, fresh main.
high_priority.how: Create `scripts/preflight.sh` that checks all items and exits non-zero on failure.

medium_priority.impact: Allow agent to create multiple PRs without rebasing between each. Use GitHub's auto-rebase feature or a merge queue.
medium_priority.how: Enable merge queue in repo settings. Agent creates all PRs, queue handles ordering.

medium_priority.impact: Agent spends ~30% of time writing boilerplate test fixtures. A conftest.py with richer helpers would reduce this.
medium_priority.how: Add more helpers to conftest.py: `make_circuit_with_resistor_divider()`, `make_op_result()`, etc.

low_priority.impact: Reduces merge conflicts and makes the codebase easier for agents to navigate.
low_priority.how: Extract simulation display, menu builders, and panel management into separate files.

agent_performance_metrics.test_regression_rate: 0% (no existing tests broken, all regressions caught and fixed before commit)

quality_observations: All 7 PRs have zero test regressions — existing test count preserved or increased
Test count increased from 763 to 800 across the session (net +37 new tests from issues worked in this context window)
parse_op_results return format change was a breaking change that required updating both tests and callers — handled correctly but worth noting for future API changes
Power calculator uses parse_value from format_utils for SI prefix parsing of component values — good code reuse
OP annotation rendering reuses existing drawForeground pattern but adds _draw_label_box helper to reduce duplication
Branch currents feature in #139 adds capability but actual ngspice branch current output needs manual testing to verify parsing patterns match real output

issues_that_need_human_review.reason: Canvas rendering changes (drawForeground) need visual testing — positions of voltage/current labels may overlap at certain zoom levels
Power calculation sign convention (positive=dissipating) and edge cases for multi-terminal devices (BJT, MOSFET) not tested
ComponentPalette refactor from QListWidget to QWidget may affect drag-and-drop behavior in ways not caught by unit tests
